intro: Linaria linckiana, commonly known as the narrowleaf toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its flowers have two lips, with the upper lip being shorter and the lower lip longer, giving it a distinctive appearance. Linaria linckiana is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and its ornamental value in gardens.
